directions: Cut off one-quarter of the banana and mash it with a fork in a bowl; stir in the cream cheese, peanut butter, honey and salt. Spread over 2 bread slices.

Coat a large skillet with canola oil spray and heat to medium high. Slice the remaining banana in half lengthwise and then in half crosswise. Place the banana halves in the pan and cook until caramelized.

While the bananas are cooking, spread an equal amount of the peanut butter-banana-cream cheese mixture on each of the two pieces of bread. Arrange the cooked bananas over the cream cheese and top with the remaining bread.
Wipe out the skillet, add a spritz more canola spray and place over medium heat. Add the sandwiches and cook until browned on each side.
title: Grilled Banana Sandwich
